alert.note: Alert for Clay; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:18AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy showers impacting portions of central Nicholas, southwestern Webster and central Clay Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 613 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy showers centered approximately 8 miles north of Summersville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Clay, Camden-On-gauley, Camden On Gauley, Craigsville, Harrison, Widen, Calvin, Bickmore, Canvas and Muddlety. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 37 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
